person.persName: John Evans Carson (Lincoln County, Kentucky, farmer, hotel keeper, police judge, and home guard corporal (U.S.A.))

body.p: Lincoln County, Kentucky, farmer, hotelkeeper, police judge, and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Marinda Fish Carson. Father of Sarah Carson, James Carson, Joseph Carson, John N. Carson, Mary "Polly" A. Carson, Zachariah T. Carson, George Carson, Thomas B. Carson, and John E. Carson, Jr. Married to Almina Miller Carson. Father of David Carson and Hyatt Fish Carson. Stepfather of William Miller and Belle Miller. Farmer in Rockcastle County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Rockcastle County in 1850. Hotelkeeper in Lincoln County in 1860. Employed William Parks as a laborer in Lincoln County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Lincoln County in 1860. Police judge of Crab Orchard in Lincoln County in 1861. Served in the Rockcastle and Lincoln County Home Guards (U.S.A.) as a corporal from May 7, 1862, to July 7, 1862. Police judge of Crab Orchard in Lincoln County in 1864.
